attributes.action: Allow the performance of Parry's 'Jerusalem' as a national anthem for England in sporting and social events in the same fashion as 'Land of My Fathers', 'Flower of Scotland' and 'Ireland's Call'.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: This petition is not an attempt to officially modify the national anthem of England or Britain as such - it is merely targetted at sporting and social events where 'God Save the Queen' is performed as the national anthem of England - which is unfair, as it denies us the passionate national identity that a song such as 'Flower of Scotland'. Furthermore, from the perspective of a musician  - 'Jerusalem' is an infinitely superior composition than the quasi-funeral dirge 'God save the Queen'.

reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
